climbs.name: SouthWest Corner
climbs.fa: unknown- done OS free solo by 'the minions' on 6/12/03

content.description: From the west end of Hobo rock, go just south of the overhanging west face and climb up and diagonaly left on large holds to reach the summit ridge, then up and East to the true summit. The climb is mellow and is secure.Downclimb via the easy East Face.
content.protection: A very light standard rack, if any. The route was On-sight free soloed, and gear was not much on our minds.

content.description:
The base of the Hobo is cluttered with fallen blocks. The largest of these leans against the East face. You can scramble up this block and down the other side onto the East face or just climb up to the notch between them.

From there, it is some easy 100+ feet of enjoyable, solid rock, Flatiron scrambling.

The summit is small and exposed, the views of Stairway and Satan's Slab are hard to beat.

Descent - downclimb the route you just climbed.
